p1a_ssot_constrained_permutation.ssot_cv_note: CV with SSoT quintuple {7,6,5,3,1} for physical ordering = 19.49% (vs 6.66% from best-fit quintuple). Physical ordering is rank 3/120 under SSoT-fixed quintuple.

p1b_bestfit_quintuple_disclosure.disclosure_statement: Session 6 reported mean |deviation| = 17.1% using SSoT quintuple {7,6,5,3,1} with R_base = 11.459 Mpc/h. The actual computation used quintuple {8,5,4,3,2} with R_base = 9.896 Mpc/h. Deviation from ACTUAL computation: 5.0% (not 17.1%). The best-fit R_base = 9.896 Mpc/h deviates from SSoT formula 3/(2κ) = 11.459 Mpc/h by 13.6%. This 13.7% deviation from the SSoT R_base is a measure of the Leech lattice hypothesis failure; it was NOT disclosed in Session 6.

p2a_corrected_beta_interpretation.session6_wrong_statement: β_KiDS-fold = 1.000 vs β_others mean = 3.121 → KiDS requires β ≈ 1.0 [INCORRECT CAUSAL INFERENCE]
p2a_corrected_beta_interpretation.corrected_statement: β_KiDS-fold = 1.000 is the β estimated when KiDS is EXCLUDED from training (i.e., DES + CFHTLenS + DLS + HSC alone). The 4-survey dataset without KiDS prefers β ≈ 1.00. Including KiDS in training drives β upward to ~3.1. KiDS (low z_eff=0.26, high k_eff=0.70) is the primary driver pushing β from ~1.0 toward ~3.1. The correct conclusion: KiDS exerts dominant leverage on β estimation; β is non-universal (Δβ = -2.12 when KiDS is included vs excluded).

causal_direction.without_KiDS: β ≈ 1.00 (4 surveys: DES, CFHTLenS, DLS, HSC)
causal_direction.KiDS_effect: KiDS inclusion increases β by Δβ = +2.12

p2a_corrected_beta_interpretation.what_is_correct: β non-universality diagnosis (Δβ = -2.12) stands. Only the causal attribution is corrected: KiDS DRIVES β high (not low).

p2b_honest_bootstrap_robustness.bootstrap_mc_interpretation: Bootstrap MC p = 0.3165. In 68.3% of Bootstrap trials, adding ±10% noise DEGRADES CV below the actual CV. Correct label: MODERATE ROBUSTNESS — NOT 'ROBUST'. Threshold p_mc >= 0.20 → 'ROBUST' has no statistical basis and is REMOVED.
p2b_honest_bootstrap_robustness.revised_bootstrap_label: MODERATE ROBUSTNESS (p_MC=0.316; Bootstrap MC alone insufficient)

primary_robustness_metric.verdict: ROBUST (B+P primary metric): Under ±10% noise, 76% of trials maintain p < 0.05. This is the principled robustness measure for R-6.

p2b_honest_bootstrap_robustness.correct_r6_robustness_statement: R-6 robustness relies on the B+P combined test: 76% of Bootstrap trials maintain p < 0.05 (median per-trial p = 0.025). Bootstrap MC alone (p = 0.317) is a secondary metric indicating MODERATE robustness of the CV magnitude to noise. The permutation test significance (ordering) is the primary claim.

p3_r3_keff_correction.interpretation: R₀ = 7.09 × k_eff^(-0.478) × (1+z)^2.1667. k_eff-dependent fit: γ = 0.478 (power-law slope). LOO-CV MAE = 1.023σ. Surveys with |tension| < 1.5σ: 4/5. R-3 CV target check: 24.9% > 10% ✗

v24_requirements.R-6 (perm p < 0.05): ⚠️ REVISED: Session 5/6 p=0.0167 was best-fit quintuple. SSoT-constrained p=0.0250 (PASS)
